statement:
Suppose $p\colon V\to {\mathbb{R}}$ is a seminorm on a real (or complex)
vector space $V$. Then

1.  $p(0)=0$,

2.  $p(v)\ge 0$ for all $v\in V$.

Property $1$ follows using homogeneity;
$$p(0)=p(0\cdot 0) = |0| p(0) =0.$$ Property $2$ follows using
sublinearity and Property 1; $$0=p(0)=p(v-v) \le p(v)+p(-v) = 2p(v).$$
